paragraphs.content: To the chief Musician upon Jonath-elem-rechokim, Michtam of David, when the Philistines took him in Gath.
paragraphs.contentHtml: To the chief Musician upon Jonath-elem-rechokim, Michtam of David, when the Philistines took him in Gath.

paragraphs.content: Be merciful unto me, O God: for man would swallow me up; he fighting daily oppresseth me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Be merciful unto me, O God: for man would swallow me up; he fighting daily oppresseth me.

paragraphs.content: Mine enemies would daily swallow me up: for they be many that fight against me, O thou most High.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Mine enemies would daily swallow me up: for they be many that fight against me, O thou most High.

paragraphs.content: What time I am afraid, I will trust in thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: What time I am afraid, I will trust in thee.

paragraphs.content: In God I will praise his word, in God I have put my trust; I will not fear what flesh can do unto me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: In God I will praise his word, in God I have put my trust; I will not fear what flesh can do unto me.

paragraphs.content: Every day they wrest my words: all their thoughts are against me for evil.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Every day they wrest my words: all their thoughts are against me for evil.

paragraphs.content: They gather themselves together, they hide themselves, they mark my steps, when they wait for my soul.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They gather themselves together, they hide themselves, they mark my steps, when they wait for my soul.

paragraphs.content: Shall they escape by iniquity? in thine anger cast down the people, O God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Shall they escape by iniquity? in thine anger cast down the people, O God.

paragraphs.content: Thou tellest my wanderings: put thou my tears into thy bottle: are they not in thy book?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thou tellest my wanderings: put thou my tears into thy bottle: are they not in thy book?

paragraphs.content: When I cry unto thee, then shall mine enemies turn back: this I know; for God is for me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When I cry unto thee, then shall mine enemies turn back: this I know; for God is for me.

paragraphs.content: In God will I praise his word: in the LORD will I praise his word.
paragraphs.contentHtml: In God will I praise his word: in the Lord will I praise his word.

paragraphs.content: In God have I put my trust: I will not be afraid what man can do unto me.
paragraphs.contentHtml: In God have I put my trust: I will not be afraid what man can do unto me.

paragraphs.content: Thy vows are upon me, O God: I will render praises unto thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Thy vows are upon me, O God: I will render praises unto thee.

paragraphs.content: For thou hast delivered my soul from death: wilt not thou deliver my feet from falling, that I may walk before God in the light of the living?
paragraphs.contentHtml: For thou hast delivered my soul from death: wilt not thou deliver my feet from falling, that I may walk before God in the light of the living?
